Business Systems Analyst: Partner Incentives (hybrid) - 2002684

Meet the team

Within Cisco IT, our vision is to be loved as the world’s best IT organization. The CRM Engineering and Transformation Office (CETO) is on a mission to deliver One Team. One Experience. One Cisco through CRM architecture, data frameworks, governance, and AI-driven solutions.

As part of CETO, the Sales Compensation team focuses on delivering a simplified and intuitive Seller and Partner experience. Through Partner Incentives and Metrics, we influence internal sellers and external partners to drive recurring revenue growth and business transformation. You’ll work with a highly collaborative and empowered team of engineers, architects, business analysts, and multi-functional leaders across Sales, Legal, Finance, Business Operations, and Customer/Partner Experience.

Your impact

As a Business System Analyst, you’ll play a pivotal role in designing, building, and scaling next-generation partner incentive platforms that align with Cisco’s strategy and enable growth. In this role, you will:
• Incorporate AI capabilities by interpreting AI-generated insights, demonstrating AI tools for advanced data analysis, and improving strategic decision-making processes.
• Partner with business sponsors, architects, and operational teams to gather, refine, and document requirements.
• Perform data analysis, process simplification, and platform configuration to deliver scalable solutions.
• Collaborate with technical architects and development leads to define and document system capabilities and features.
• Build and run user stories, solution blueprints, and functional testing (including regression and progression automation).
• Solve and resolve end-user, partner, and support team issues.
• Conduct post-project evaluations to identify improvements and growth opportunities.
• Assess risks, dependencies, and downstream impacts while reporting project status to team members.
• Apply Agile methodologies, standards, and documentation practices for automation and system maintenance.

Minimum qualifications :
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or relevant Engineering field with strong Computer Science fundamentals and 5+ years of professional experience in designing and building applications, OR
• Master’s degree in Computer Science or relevant Engineering field with strong Computer Science fundamentals and 2+ years of professional experience in designing and building applications.
• Hands-on experience with big data in Oracle and Snowflake.
• Experience with incentive management, including business processes, data, and architectural concepts related to partner compensation models.
• Familiarity with AI concepts, tools, and their application in business analysis.
• Ability to interpret and validate AI-generated data and recommendations.

Preferred qualifications :
• Experience with Varicent ICM and GenAI capabilities.
• Good understanding of N-Tier architecture concepts and their influence on build, development, and deployment.
• Validated experience in incubating, conceptualizing, planning, crafting, and leading ground-breaking projects.
• Strong knowledge of Agile development methodologies.
• Superb communication, organizational, and collaboration skills to thrive in a team-driven environment.

Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components, subject to the applicable Cisco plan. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco typically pays as follows:
• .75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota;

For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay 0% up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

job_description:
Job Description

Primary Function of Position

The Business Analyst will possess functional understanding of Direct Procurement and Master Data management business processes and will be a key person implementing business processes software solutions and systems implementation in Procurement and Master Data Management on Applications like SAP MM, SAP MDG etc. The role will be of a systems solution expert for identifying, analyzing, refining, translating, and finally documenting business requirements from ISI business teams. Translating the business requirements into Functional requirement specifications, Function design documents and Functional technical specifications. The individual will perform the configuration in the system and be responsible for conducting unit, integration and regression testing.

Essential Job Duties
• Analyze business processes, perform fit-gap analysis as required, and provide ISI business teams with cost efficient proposals on inefficiencies and risks to determine appropriate process and system design.
• Perform hands-on configuration in SAP MM module to satisfy business requirements.
• Create functional specifications and work with cross-functional teams and development teams to deliver the technical objects.
• Review and contribute to design document, configuration documents and functional specifications.
• Conduct unit and Integration and regression testing.
• Support ISI’s procurement processes and all associated business systems functions.
• Work with ISI IT and business teams to optimize and streamline business processes and technical solutions.
• Identify gaps between current and future state of business processes and help in prioritizing opportunities to improving processes through the usage of Business capability matrix (BCM)
• Participate in business user meetings to gather process information to propose sound system solutions.
• Collaborate and provide inputs to the development team during development phase to meet the business needs.
• Help business teams with reporting requirements and work in conjunction with data warehousing team to deliver management reports.
• Conduct QA validations and participate on User Acceptance Testing (UAT) tests.
• Support, assist and train the users on new modified system configurations highlighting the impact on business processes.
• Maintain IT Business system integrity and application notes, system upgrades, changes, and user updates.
• Work closely with onsite team, offshore team, managers, and executives to ensure the release of high-quality solutions.
• Follow the Intuitive change management process. Analyze impact of changes to the corporate application landscape.

job_title: Business Analyst II, Financial Planning & Analysis, Shopbop

apply_options.publisher: USNLX Ability Jobs - National Labor Exchange

job_description:
Description

Shopbop is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to drive strategic financial planning and business optimization initiatives across the organization. This role will focus on developing financial models, conducting business performance analysis, and providing data-driven insights to support key business decisions. The successful candidate will be instrumental in building and maintaining sophisticated financial models that drive strategic planning, budgeting, and forecasting processes. They will work closely with multiple business units and cross-functional partners to optimize revenue opportunities, manage costs, and identify areas for business improvement. The role requires someone who can translate complex financial analyses into actionable insights for stakeholders across the organization.

Key job responsibilities
• Develop and maintain financial models to support business planning, forecasting, and strategic initiatives
• Create and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports to track business performance and identify trends
• Partner with business leaders to develop revenue forecasts and expense budgets
• Build and maintain dashboards to monitor key business metrics and KPIs
• Conduct variance analysis and provide insights on business performance against plans
• Support strategic initiatives through financial modeling, scenario analysis, and ROI assessment
• Perform market analysis and competitive benchmarking to identify business opportunities
• Analyze customer behavior and revenue trends to support growth strategies
• Develop and automate reporting solutions to improve efficiency and data accuracy
• Partner with cross-functional teams to drive process improvements and operational efficiency
• Support business cases for new initiatives with comprehensive financial analysis

Basic Qualifications
• 3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
• 5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
• 3+ years of business or financial analysis experience
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent
• Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
• Experience with Excel
• Experience with SQL
• Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
• Strong understanding of financial statements and accounting principles
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience in IBM Cognos TM1/Planning Analytics work including system configuration, model building and developing reports or dashboards with TM1
• Experience using data visualization tools
• Experience in stakeholder management, dealing with multiple stakeholders at varied levels of the organization
• Experience using Oracle, or experience in solving complex business challenges by delivering accurate and timely financial models, analysis, and recommendations that have a proven impact on business (e.g., financial savings, operational improvements, or customer benefits)
